title: Sunset Crater Volcano National Monument: Plan Your Visit
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit           Plan Your Visit        Welcome to Sunset Crater Volcano National Monument       NPS Photo (B.Sutton)            **Sunset Crater Volcano will begin summer hours on Friday, May 22, 2015. The Visitor Center will be open from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.**   We hope this page helps you plan your trip. Explore the pages below and download a copy of the Flagstaff Area National Monument newspaper Ancient Times if you're planning on visiting either of our sister parks, Wupatki or Walnut Canyon National Monument.   Most visitors drive through the 34 mile scenic loop that winds from Highway 89 through Sunset Crater Volcano and Wupatki National Monuments. The scenic loop leads you from the high Ponderosa Pine forests of Sunset Crater, down nearly 2,000 feet in elevation to the red rocks and painted desert vistas of Wupatki. Enjoy your trip!           Ranger Luke at Lenox Crater Trail NPS Photo  Interpretive Programs We offer Ranger Guided programs every day during the summer.          Sunrise lights up Ponderosa Pines above the Bonito Lava Flow. NPS Photo (N.Daffron)  Directions and Maps    To help you find your way.            Asters grow in Bonito Meadow. NPS Photo  Operating Hours and Seasons Get information about our visitor center hours.        Quaking Aspen turn gold in the fall. NPS Photo (H.Rich)  Fees and Reservations Information about entrance fees, group rates, and special use permits.        The Aa Trail get visitors into the flow. NPS Photo   Trails and Hikes Find a hike to fit your interest and ability.
